item.title: I don’t blame anyone for their decision to stay away from the bad place
item.description: https://www.theguardian.com/music/2026/jan/30/brian-may-says-us-is-currently-too-dangerous-for-queen-to-tour-there Queen guitarist Brian May has ruled out touring in the US for the foreseeable future, because of the potential danger it would pose. Speaking to the Daily Mail, the 78-year-old said: “America is a dangerous place at the moment, so you have to take that into account. “It’s very sad because I feel like Queen grew up in America and we love it, but it’s not what it was. Everyone is thinking twice about going there at the moment.” May did not specify the particular dangers they might face, but his comments come at a time when many American citizens and foreign visitors fear violence from ICE agents or examination of their political beliefs, and the threat of mass shootings – 425 such incidents in 2025, killing 420 people and wounding 1,898 – remains ever present. The British dance music star Piri cited “what’s going on in the US right now” as a factor when she cancelled a US tour earlier this week. In 2025, the Hungarian classical pianist András Schiff cancelled US concerts, saying: “Due to the recent and unprecedented political changes in the United States, I feel morally obligated to withdraw from all engagements in the US.” Also in 2025, Puerto Rican megastar Bad Bunny was asked by i-D magazine if the reason he didn’t schedule any US concerts last year was due to fears about deportation of Latino audience members. “Man, honestly, yes,” he replied. “There were many reasons why I didn’t show up in the US, and none of them were out of hate … But there was the issue of – like, fucking ICE could be outside [a concert]. And it’s something that we were talking about and very concerned about.” Numerous events celebrating Latin heritage and culture have been cancelled since ICE ramped up activity during Donald Trump’s second term, due to fears they will be targeted by anti-immigration agents. There are concerns beyond arts and cultural events, particularly around this year’s World Cup being hosted mostly in the US, and the implications for thousands of fans travelling from abroad. The US is seeing a collapse in tourism revenue. In May 2025, the World Travel & Tourism Council projected that the US would lose $12.5bn (£9.35bn) in international visitor spending across the year. Figures later in the year supported that fall, with International Trade Administration, a US government body, finding that international visitor spending dropped 5.5% in September 2025 compared with September 2024. Fears were compounded by the proposal by the US Department for Homeland Security and border officials to examine five years of social media activity by potential visitors to the US prior to being granted entry.
item.dc:creator: DownvotesStarWars

item.title: Save America Movement Asks New Yorkers What They Think About Melania
item.description: A complete non sequitur: I remember going with friends to see a Movie Preview of "The Incredible Melting Man", the theater was basically empty before it was half over. Everyone else hated it, but we thought it was one of the funniest things ever – there may have been brownies involved. Made in 1977 and I think it's still in the bottom 3 of the 100 Worst Movies Ever Made list. That could now be in jeopardy.

26 Imgur Creator Spotlight: This is by @PaintMags Check out the rest of the stuff in their posts and leave some love.
27 Man Tax: Andre Hamann
“It is the artist's business to create sunshine when the sun fails.” - Romain Rolland So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! Here's the new one https://discord.gg/NPStJGgARq - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work, zero income. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've honestly been my lifeline. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me

item.title: Pre -Royal Rumble Dump
item.description:
Finally have my 14 year old playing this - I’ve never seen him get mad at a game and watching him unsuccessfully catch a chocobo for 20 mins was one of the funniest things I’ve ever seen
I went like 20 years without seeing upside down cakes in stores and now piggly wiggly is cranking out like 5 different types
I like to believe this is the verification picture they took to show they delivered it
Love it
Has anyone ever had ChatGPT tell them they were wrong ? I feel like it always has your back
Dropping a free coupon since it’s about to get cold make sure all the fluids are topped off guys
My whole company used them so I didn’t had to upload any documents for 2 days and it was glorious
Nope just got hit for $29
I’ve been getting all the Elmo / Rocko crash out vids - good stuff
Fair warning WHEN Jericho comes back today I will be unbearable - just don’t come back to my page -you’ve been warned
And 2 months late but Anya is now a year old - you guys have seen her every step of the way - she’s still skittish when more then 2 people enter the room but she’s up my butt every night when it’s just me here .Hope you all have a great weekend - stay warm and stay safe

item.title: Steam is being sued for $900million, because it is a "Monopoly"
item.description: https://www.ign.com/articles/steam-owner-valve-faces-900-million-lawsuit-over-pc-monopoly-claims-following-uk-tribunal-ruling https://x.com/Pirat_Nation/status/2017236859479290227 TLDR - Steam is being sued in the UK via various groups calling it a "Monopoly" due to having the largest market share when it comes to digital distribution. Even thought it has out right competitors like GOG, EPIC Store, BattleNet, Microsoft Store, UBISoft Store, EA Store, and various other online digital outlets. The 30% fee is also misleading, considering you get •a store page to sell your game. •storage on their server to supply the game. •a community hub & communication platform for players of your game. •access to their millions of customers. •front store page viewership for a bit to showcase your game. (I’ve discovered many small titles this way.)

item.title: GovBrief Today #365
item.description: One year ago tonight, ten days into Trump's second administration, I started sending headlines to family and friends because I was horrified at how fast our norms, rules, and laws were being shattered. By day three, I was posting publicly. My friends and connections shared it, and by day four, strangers were sharing it and connecting with me. Somehow, an old man yelling at a cloud turned into 365 straight nights of tracking what this administration has done, failed to do, or refused to stop. I haven't missed a night. Not Christmas. Not Thanksgiving. Not my anniversary. I'm being self-indulgent at the one year mark to ask a favor. If you're not subscribed to the email, please do. Social media has proven unreliable. Algorithms bury things, and posts vanish. The email shows up every night. If you already subscribe, get one person to join you. That's it. One person who needs this but doesn't know it exists. You're not going to be charged. Ever. This is about making an incoherent mess accessible to people who can't doomscroll but need to know what's happening. 365 down. We keep going. Subscribe or read at govbrief.today Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com #govbrieftoday #resist [1] https://go.govbrief.today/protester-car-hit [2] https://go.govbrief.today/us-canada-airplanes [3] https://go.govbrief.today/israel-saudi-weapons [4] https://go.govbrief.today/un-finances [5] https://go.govbrief.today/measles-canyon-idaho [6] https://go.govbrief.today/newsom-oz [7] https://go.govbrief.today/nasa-artemis-delay [8] https://go.govbrief.today/matsumoto-bls-pick [9] https://go.govbrief.today/warsh-fed-chair [10] https://go.govbrief.today/don-lemon-arrested [11] https://go.govbrief.today/pretti-shooting-probe [12] https://go.govbrief.today/final-epstein-files [13] https://go.govbrief.today/ca-courthouse-arrests [14] https://go.govbrief.today/judge-blocks-voter-proof [15] https://go.govbrief.today/energy-violated-law [16] https://go.govbrief.today/slavery-exhibit-judge [17] https://go.govbrief.today/ice-hospital-tensions [18] https://go.govbrief.today/self-deporting-suit [19] https://go.govbrief.today/partial-shutdown-begins [20] https://go.govbrief.today/ice-protests Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com

item.title: Utahns protest ICE
item.description:
Protesters packed into Washington Square before marching to a Salt Lake City field office of Citizenship and Immigration Services.
Across Utah, protesters left schools, stood on curbs holding signs, and marched as they chanted to demand reforms to federal immigration enforcement after high-profile raids and shootings have spurred responses across the United States.
The national demonstration was planned to protest the actions of agents from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement and U.S. Customs and Border Protection. The agencies’ agents killed Silverio Villegas González in a Chicago suburb in September, Keith “Pooter” Porter Jr. in Los Angeles on New Year’s Eve, and Renee Good and Alex Pretti less than a month apart in Minneapolis.

item.title: Apollos best friend, SnackMan was at work today!
item.description: I don't know much about SnackMan. I know he works for a local business that does concert and arena sound, and I once spoke to a colleague of his who told me that SnackMan lets his colleagues drop their dogs off at his station, almost like a doggy daycare. I also know that he gives a snack to every dog that walks past on this walkway that is allowed one from their owner. He must buy in bulk. Bottom line is: SnackMan loves dogs, and the dogs love SnackMan. The world needs more superheroes like him.
item.dc:creator: sv1rr

item.title: A different kind of cat tax
item.description:
This is my fourth (4th) favourite tattoo
Good morning Imgur! I just love my cats so much, but also I'm honestly just a bystander in their world. The cat on the crescent in the first image is one of my more recent tattoos. If I were to be a bit mysterious and symbolic, I'd say it's a tattoo about feminine intuition, or whimsy and freedom, or a connection to the spiritual. It wouldn't technically be wrong, but also I got it after a bit of a fright at a visit to the vet a little while back. P.S: I put some of the baby pictures in there too because everyone loves kittens. P.P.S: Cats.
Bonus: the Cone of Shame™ for misbehaving after surgery.
item.dc:creator: DysnomianThoughts
